integration.compatibility_matrixÂ¶

Source: src\integration\compatibility_matrix.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Cross-domain compatibility validation matrix for comprehensive system integration.

This module provides sophisticated compatibility validation across all project domains including controllers, optimization, testing, analysis, configuration, and HIL systems. It ensures seamless integration and identifies potential conflicts before they impact production systems.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#==========================================================================================\\\
  2#====================== src/integration/compatibility_matrix.py =========================\\\
  3#==========================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Cross-domain compatibility validation matrix for comprehensive system integration.
  6
  7This module provides sophisticated compatibility validation across all project domains
  8including controllers, optimization, testing, analysis, configuration, and HIL systems.
  9It ensures seamless integration and identifies potential conflicts before they impact
 10production systems.
 11"""
 12
 13import sys
 14import inspect
 15import importlib
 16from pathlib import Path
 17from typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional
 18from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 19from enum import Enum
 20import logging
 21import json
 22import time
 23
 24# Add project paths for comprehensive imports
 25PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent
 26sys.path.insert(0, str(PROJECT_ROOT))
 27sys.path.insert(0, str(PROJECT_ROOT / "src"))
 28
 29logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
 30
 31class CompatibilityLevel(Enum):
 32    """Compatibility assessment levels with increasing strictness."""
 33    COMPATIBLE = "compatible"
 34    WARNING = "warning"
 35    INCOMPATIBLE = "incompatible"
 36    UNKNOWN = "unknown"
 37
 38class DomainType(Enum):
 39    """Project domain types for compatibility analysis."""
 40    CONTROLLERS = "controllers"
 41    OPTIMIZATION = "optimization"
 42    TESTING = "testing"
 43    ANALYSIS = "analysis"
 44    CONFIGURATION = "configuration"
 45    HIL = "hil"
 46    INTERFACES = "interfaces"
 47    UTILITIES = "utilities"
 48
 49@dataclass
 50class CompatibilityIssue:
 51    """Represents a compatibility issue between system components."""
 52    domain_a: DomainType
 53    domain_b: DomainType
 54    component_a: str
 55    component_b: str
 56    issue_type: str
 57    severity: CompatibilityLevel
 58    description: str
 59    recommendation: str
 60    affected_functionality: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 61
 62@dataclass
 63class IntegrationPoint:
 64    """Represents an integration point between domains."""
 65    source_domain: DomainType
 66    target_domain: DomainType
 67    interface_type: str
 68    data_flow: str
 69    dependencies: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 70    validation_status: CompatibilityLevel = CompatibilityLevel.UNKNOWN
 71
 72@dataclass
 73class DomainHealth:
 74    """Health status of a specific domain."""
 75    domain: DomainType
 76    overall_health: CompatibilityLevel
 77    component_count: int
 78    test_coverage: float
 79    integration_points: int
 80    critical_issues: List[CompatibilityIssue] = field(default_factory=list)
 81    performance_metrics: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 82
 83class CompatibilityMatrix:
 84    """Comprehensive compatibility validation matrix for cross-domain integration.
 85
 86    This class provides sophisticated analysis of compatibility between all project
 87    domains, identifying potential integration issues and providing actionable
 88    recommendations for resolution.
 89    """
 90
 91    def __init__(self, project_root: Path = PROJECT_ROOT):
 92        """Initialize compatibility matrix with comprehensive domain mapping.
 93
 94        Args:
 95            project_root: Path to the project root directory
 96        """
 97        self.project_root = project_root
 98        self.src_path = project_root / "src"
 99
100        # Domain module mappings
101        self.domain_modules = {
102            DomainType.CONTROLLERS: [
103                "src.controllers.factory",
104                "src.controllers.smc",
105                "src.controllers.mpc",
106                "src.controllers.specialized"
107            ],
108            DomainType.OPTIMIZATION: [
109                "src.optimizer.pso_optimizer"
110            ],
111            DomainType.TESTING: [
112                "tests.test_controllers",
113                "tests.test_optimization",
114                "tests.test_integration"
115            ],
116            DomainType.ANALYSIS: [
117                "src.utils.analysis",
118                "src.utils.visualization",
119                "src.benchmarks"
120            ],
121            DomainType.CONFIGURATION: [
122                "src.config"
123            ],
124            DomainType.HIL: [
125                "src.interfaces.hardware",
126                "src.interfaces.hil"
127            ],
128            DomainType.INTERFACES: [
129                "src.interfaces.data_exchange",
130                "src.interfaces.monitoring"
131            ],
132            DomainType.UTILITIES: [
133                "src.utils.validation",
134                "src.utils.control",
135                "src.utils.monitoring"
136            ]
137        }
138
139        # Critical integration points
140        self.integration_points = [
141            IntegrationPoint(
142                DomainType.CONTROLLERS, DomainType.OPTIMIZATION,
143                "parameter_tuning", "bidirectional",
144                ["gain_bounds", "controller_factory", "fitness_evaluation"]
145            ),
146            IntegrationPoint(
147                DomainType.CONTROLLERS, DomainType.CONFIGURATION,
148                "parameter_validation", "unidirectional",
149                ["config_schema", "parameter_bounds", "validation_rules"]
150            ),
151            IntegrationPoint(
152                DomainType.TESTING, DomainType.CONTROLLERS,
153                "functional_validation", "unidirectional",
154                ["test_fixtures", "stability_analysis", "performance_metrics"]
155            ),
156            IntegrationPoint(
157                DomainType.ANALYSIS, DomainType.CONTROLLERS,
158                "performance_monitoring", "unidirectional",
159                ["metrics_collection", "visualization", "statistical_analysis"]
160            ),
161            IntegrationPoint(
162                DomainType.HIL, DomainType.CONTROLLERS,
163                "real_time_control", "bidirectional",
164                ["communication_protocol", "latency_constraints", "safety_monitoring"]
165            ),
166            IntegrationPoint(
167                DomainType.INTERFACES, DomainType.HIL,
168                "hardware_abstraction", "bidirectional",
169                ["device_drivers", "data_exchange", "error_handling"]
170            )
171        ]
172
173        # Compatibility rules and constraints
174        self.compatibility_rules = {
175            "memory_management": {
176                "domains": [DomainType.OPTIMIZATION, DomainType.ANALYSIS],
177                "constraint": "bounded_memory_usage",
178                "threshold": "1GB"
179            },
180            "numerical_stability": {
181                "domains": [DomainType.CONTROLLERS, DomainType.OPTIMIZATION],
182                "constraint": "numerical_precision",
183                "threshold": "1e-12"
184            },
185            "real_time_constraints": {
186                "domains": [DomainType.CONTROLLERS, DomainType.HIL],
187                "constraint": "timing_deadlines",
188                "threshold": "10ms"
189            },
190            "thread_safety": {
191                "domains": [DomainType.HIL, DomainType.INTERFACES],
192                "constraint": "concurrent_access",
193                "threshold": "thread_safe"
194            }
195        }
196
197    def analyze_full_system_compatibility(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
198        """Perform comprehensive compatibility analysis across all domains.
199
200        Returns:
201            Complete compatibility analysis results with recommendations
202        """
203        start_time = time.time()
204
205        # Analyze individual domain health
206        domain_health = self._analyze_domain_health()
207
208        # Validate integration points
209        integration_status = self._validate_integration_points()
210
211        # Check cross-domain compatibility rules
212        rule_violations = self._check_compatibility_rules()
213
214        # Identify potential conflicts
215        compatibility_issues = self._identify_compatibility_issues()
216
217        # Generate overall system health score
218        system_health = self._calculate_system_health_score(
219            domain_health, integration_status, rule_violations
220        )
221
222        # Generate actionable recommendations
223        recommendations = self._generate_compatibility_recommendations(
224            compatibility_issues, rule_violations
225        )
226
227        analysis_time = time.time() - start_time
228
229        return {
230            "timestamp": time.time(),
231            "analysis_duration": analysis_time,
232            "system_health_score": system_health,
233            "domain_health": {domain.value: asdict(health) for domain, health in domain_health.items()},
234            "integration_points": [asdict(point) for point in integration_status],
235            "rule_violations": rule_violations,
236            "compatibility_issues": [asdict(issue) for issue in compatibility_issues],
237            "recommendations": recommendations,
238            "production_readiness": self._assess_production_readiness(system_health, rule_violations)
239        }
240
241    def _analyze_domain_health(self) -> Dict[DomainType, DomainHealth]:
242        """Analyze health status of individual domains."""
243        domain_health = {}
244
245        for domain, modules in self.domain_modules.items():
246            try:
247                health = self._assess_single_domain_health(domain, modules)
248                domain_health[domain] = health
249            except Exception as e:
250                logger.warning(f"Failed to assess health for domain {domain.value}: {e}")
251                domain_health[domain] = DomainHealth(
252                    domain=domain,
253                    overall_health=CompatibilityLevel.UNKNOWN,
254                    component_count=0,
255                    test_coverage=0.0,
256                    integration_points=0
257                )
258
259        return domain_health
260
261    def _assess_single_domain_health(self, domain: DomainType, modules: List[str]) -> DomainHealth:
262        """Assess health of a single domain."""
263        component_count = 0
264        importable_modules = 0
265        critical_issues = []
266
267        for module_name in modules:
268            try:
269                # Try to import module to check availability
270                module = importlib.import_module(module_name)
271                importable_modules += 1
272
273                # Count components (classes and functions)
274                for name, obj in inspect.getmembers(module):
275                    if inspect.isclass(obj) or inspect.isfunction(obj):
276                        component_count += 1
277
278            except ImportError as e:
279                critical_issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
280                    domain_a=domain,
281                    domain_b=domain,
282                    component_a=module_name,
283                    component_b="import_system",
284                    issue_type="import_error",
285                    severity=CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE,
286                    description=f"Failed to import module {module_name}: {e}",
287                    recommendation="Fix import dependencies or module structure"
288                ))
289
290        # Calculate overall health
291        if len(critical_issues) > 0:
292            overall_health = CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE
293        elif importable_modules == len(modules):
294            overall_health = CompatibilityLevel.COMPATIBLE
295        else:
296            overall_health = CompatibilityLevel.WARNING
297
298        # Estimate test coverage (simplified)
299        test_coverage = self._estimate_domain_test_coverage(domain)
300
301        # Count integration points for this domain
302        integration_count = sum(1 for point in self.integration_points
303                              if point.source_domain == domain or point.target_domain == domain)
304
305        return DomainHealth(
306            domain=domain,
307            overall_health=overall_health,
308            component_count=component_count,
309            test_coverage=test_coverage,
310            integration_points=integration_count,
311            critical_issues=critical_issues
312        )
313
314    def _estimate_domain_test_coverage(self, domain: DomainType) -> float:
315        """Estimate test coverage for a domain (simplified implementation)."""
316        # This is a simplified estimation - in practice, would integrate with coverage tools
317        coverage_estimates = {
318            DomainType.CONTROLLERS: 85.0,
319            DomainType.OPTIMIZATION: 75.0,
320            DomainType.TESTING: 90.0,
321            DomainType.ANALYSIS: 70.0,
322            DomainType.CONFIGURATION: 80.0,
323            DomainType.HIL: 60.0,
324            DomainType.INTERFACES: 65.0,
325            DomainType.UTILITIES: 75.0
326        }
327        return coverage_estimates.get(domain, 50.0)
328
329    def _validate_integration_points(self) -> List[IntegrationPoint]:
330        """Validate all defined integration points for compatibility."""
331        validated_points = []
332
333        for point in self.integration_points:
334            try:
335                # Validate that source and target domains are healthy
336                source_health = self._check_domain_availability(point.source_domain)
337                target_health = self._check_domain_availability(point.target_domain)
338
339                if source_health and target_health:
340                    point.validation_status = CompatibilityLevel.COMPATIBLE
341                else:
342                    point.validation_status = CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE
343
344                validated_points.append(point)
345
346            except Exception as e:
347                logger.warning(f"Failed to validate integration point {point.interface_type}: {e}")
348                point.validation_status = CompatibilityLevel.UNKNOWN
349                validated_points.append(point)
350
351        return validated_points
352
353    def _check_domain_availability(self, domain: DomainType) -> bool:
354        """Check if a domain is available and functional."""
355        modules = self.domain_modules.get(domain, [])
356
357        for module_name in modules:
358            try:
359                importlib.import_module(module_name)
360            except ImportError:
361                return False
362
363        return True
364
365    def _check_compatibility_rules(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
366        """Check system-wide compatibility rules and constraints."""
367        violations = []
368
369        for rule_name, rule_config in self.compatibility_rules.items():
370            try:
371                violation = self._validate_compatibility_rule(rule_name, rule_config)
372                if violation:
373                    violations.append(violation)
374            except Exception as e:
375                logger.warning(f"Failed to check compatibility rule {rule_name}: {e}")
376
377        return violations
378
379    def _validate_compatibility_rule(self, rule_name: str, rule_config: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
380        """Validate a specific compatibility rule."""
381        domains = rule_config["domains"]
382        rule_config["constraint"]
383        threshold = rule_config["threshold"]
384
385        # Simplified rule validation - in practice, would implement specific checks
386        if rule_name == "memory_management":
387            # Check if memory-intensive domains have proper memory management
388            return self._check_memory_management_rule(domains, threshold)
389        elif rule_name == "numerical_stability":
390            # Check numerical precision across domains
391            return self._check_numerical_stability_rule(domains, threshold)
392        elif rule_name == "real_time_constraints":
393            # Check timing constraints for real-time domains
394            return self._check_real_time_constraints_rule(domains, threshold)
395        elif rule_name == "thread_safety":
396            # Check thread safety for concurrent domains
397            return self._check_thread_safety_rule(domains, threshold)
398
399        return None
400
401    def _check_memory_management_rule(self, domains: List[DomainType], threshold: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
402        """Check memory management compatibility rule."""
403        # Simplified check - in practice, would analyze actual memory usage
404        for domain in domains:
405            if domain == DomainType.OPTIMIZATION:
406                # PSO optimization can be memory intensive
407                return {
408                    "rule": "memory_management",
409                    "violated_domains": [domain.value],
410                    "severity": "warning",
411                    "description": f"Domain {domain.value} may exceed memory threshold {threshold}",
412                    "recommendation": "Implement bounded memory usage in PSO algorithms"
413                }
414        return None
415
416    def _check_numerical_stability_rule(self, domains: List[DomainType], threshold: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
417        """Check numerical stability compatibility rule."""
418        # Check for potential numerical stability issues
419        return None  # Assume stable for now
420
421    def _check_real_time_constraints_rule(self, domains: List[DomainType], threshold: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
422        """Check real-time constraints compatibility rule."""
423        # Check if real-time domains meet timing requirements
424        for domain in domains:
425            if domain == DomainType.HIL:
426                # HIL systems have strict timing requirements
427                return {
428                    "rule": "real_time_constraints",
429                    "violated_domains": [domain.value],
430                    "severity": "critical",
431                    "description": f"Domain {domain.value} must meet {threshold} timing deadline",
432                    "recommendation": "Validate real-time performance in HIL integration tests"
433                }
434        return None
435
436    def _check_thread_safety_rule(self, domains: List[DomainType], threshold: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
437        """Check thread safety compatibility rule."""
438        # Check thread safety for concurrent access
439        for domain in domains:
440            if domain in [DomainType.HIL, DomainType.INTERFACES]:
441                # These domains may have thread safety issues
442                return {
443                    "rule": "thread_safety",
444                    "violated_domains": [domain.value],
445                    "severity": "warning",
446                    "description": f"Domain {domain.value} requires thread safety validation",
447                    "recommendation": "Implement thread safety tests for concurrent operations"
448                }
449        return None
450
451    def _identify_compatibility_issues(self) -> List[CompatibilityIssue]:
452        """Identify potential compatibility issues between domains."""
453        issues = []
454
455        # Check for known compatibility issues
456        issues.extend(self._check_controller_optimization_compatibility())
457        issues.extend(self._check_hil_interface_compatibility())
458        issues.extend(self._check_testing_configuration_compatibility())
459
460        return issues
461
462    def _check_controller_optimization_compatibility(self) -> List[CompatibilityIssue]:
463        """Check compatibility between controllers and optimization domains."""
464        issues = []
465
466        # Check parameter bounds compatibility
467        try:
468            # Check if both domains are available
469            import importlib.util
470            has_controllers = importlib.util.find_spec('src.controllers.factory') is not None
471            has_optimizer = importlib.util.find_spec('src.optimizer.pso_optimizer') is not None
472
473            # Check if gain bounds are compatible
474            if not (has_controllers and has_optimizer):
475                return CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE
476            # This is a simplified check - would implement detailed validation
477            issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
478                domain_a=DomainType.CONTROLLERS,
479                domain_b=DomainType.OPTIMIZATION,
480                component_a="SMCFactory",
481                component_b="PSOTuner",
482                issue_type="parameter_bounds",
483                severity=CompatibilityLevel.WARNING,
484                description="PSO parameter bounds may not be optimally configured for all controllers",
485                recommendation="Validate PSO bounds against controller stability requirements",
486                affected_functionality=["automated_tuning", "gain_optimization"]
487            ))
488
489        except ImportError as e:
490            issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
491                domain_a=DomainType.CONTROLLERS,
492                domain_b=DomainType.OPTIMIZATION,
493                component_a="controller_factory",
494                component_b="pso_optimizer",
495                issue_type="import_dependency",
496                severity=CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE,
497                description=f"Failed to import required modules: {e}",
498                recommendation="Fix import dependencies between controllers and optimization"
499            ))
500
501        return issues
502
503    def _check_hil_interface_compatibility(self) -> List[CompatibilityIssue]:
504        """Check compatibility between HIL and interface domains."""
505        issues = []
506
507        # Check for HIL interface compatibility
508        try:
509            # Try to access HIL interfaces
510            hil_path = self.src_path / "interfaces" / "hil"
511            if not hil_path.exists():
512                issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
513                    domain_a=DomainType.HIL,
514                    domain_b=DomainType.INTERFACES,
515                    component_a="hil_system",
516                    component_b="interface_layer",
517                    issue_type="missing_interface",
518                    severity=CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE,
519                    description="HIL interface layer is missing or incomplete",
520                    recommendation="Implement complete HIL interface abstraction layer"
521                ))
522
523        except Exception as e:
524            logger.warning(f"Failed to check HIL interface compatibility: {e}")
525
526        return issues
527
528    def _check_testing_configuration_compatibility(self) -> List[CompatibilityIssue]:
529        """Check compatibility between testing and configuration domains."""
530        issues = []
531
532        # Check configuration validation in tests
533        try:
534            # Check if test configuration is compatible with main configuration
535            config_path = self.project_root / "config.yaml"
536            if config_path.exists():
537                # Configuration exists - check test compatibility
538                pass  # Simplified - would implement detailed validation
539            else:
540                issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
541                    domain_a=DomainType.TESTING,
542                    domain_b=DomainType.CONFIGURATION,
543                    component_a="test_config",
544                    component_b="main_config",
545                    issue_type="missing_configuration",
546                    severity=CompatibilityLevel.WARNING,
547                    description="Main configuration file missing for test validation",
548                    recommendation="Ensure config.yaml exists and is properly structured"
549                ))
550
551        except Exception as e:
552            logger.warning(f"Failed to check testing configuration compatibility: {e}")
553
554        return issues
555
556    def _calculate_system_health_score(self, domain_health: Dict[DomainType, DomainHealth],
557                                     integration_status: List[IntegrationPoint],
558                                     rule_violations: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> float:
559        """Calculate overall system health score (0-100)."""
560        # Domain health contribution (60% of total score)
561        domain_scores = []
562        for health in domain_health.values():
563            if health.overall_health == CompatibilityLevel.COMPATIBLE:
564                domain_scores.append(100.0)
565            elif health.overall_health == CompatibilityLevel.WARNING:
566                domain_scores.append(70.0)
567            elif health.overall_health == CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE:
568                domain_scores.append(20.0)
569            else:
570                domain_scores.append(50.0)
571
572        domain_score = sum(domain_scores) / len(domain_scores) if domain_scores else 0
573
574        # Integration points contribution (30% of total score)
575        integration_scores = []
576        for point in integration_status:
577            if point.validation_status == CompatibilityLevel.COMPATIBLE:
578                integration_scores.append(100.0)
579            elif point.validation_status == CompatibilityLevel.WARNING:
580                integration_scores.append(70.0)
581            elif point.validation_status == CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE:
582                integration_scores.append(20.0)
583            else:
584                integration_scores.append(50.0)
585
586        integration_score = sum(integration_scores) / len(integration_scores) if integration_scores else 100
587
588        # Rule violations penalty (10% of total score)
589        violation_penalty = len([v for v in rule_violations if v.get("severity") == "critical"]) * 20
590        violation_penalty += len([v for v in rule_violations if v.get("severity") == "warning"]) * 10
591        violation_score = max(0, 100 - violation_penalty)
592
593        # Calculate weighted total
594        total_score = (domain_score * 0.6) + (integration_score * 0.3) + (violation_score * 0.1)
595
596        return round(total_score, 1)
597
598    def _generate_compatibility_recommendations(self, issues: List[CompatibilityIssue],
599                                              violations: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> List[str]:
600        """Generate actionable recommendations for resolving compatibility issues."""
601        recommendations = []
602
603        # Process compatibility issues
604        critical_issues = [issue for issue in issues if issue.severity == CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE]
605        warning_issues = [issue for issue in issues if issue.severity == CompatibilityLevel.WARNING]
606
607        if critical_issues:
608            recommendations.append(f"ğŸš¨ CRITICAL: Address {len(critical_issues)} incompatible components before production")
609            for issue in critical_issues[:3]:  # Top 3 critical issues
610                recommendations.append(f"   - {issue.recommendation}")
611
612        if warning_issues:
613            recommendations.append(f"âš ï¸ WARNING: Review {len(warning_issues)} compatibility warnings")
614            for issue in warning_issues[:2]:  # Top 2 warnings
615                recommendations.append(f"   - {issue.recommendation}")
616
617        # Process rule violations
618        critical_violations = [v for v in violations if v.get("severity") == "critical"]
619        warning_violations = [v for v in violations if v.get("severity") == "warning"]
620
621        if critical_violations:
622            recommendations.append(f"ğŸ”¥ URGENT: Resolve {len(critical_violations)} critical rule violations")
623            for violation in critical_violations:
624                recommendations.append(f"   - {violation.get('recommendation', 'Address violation')}")
625
626        if warning_violations:
627            recommendations.append(f"ğŸ“‹ REVIEW: Address {len(warning_violations)} rule warnings")
628
629        # General recommendations
630        recommendations.extend([
631            "ğŸ§ª Run comprehensive integration tests to validate cross-domain functionality",
632            "ğŸ“Š Monitor system health scores and address degradation promptly",
633            "ğŸ”„ Implement continuous compatibility monitoring in CI/CD pipeline",
634            "ğŸ“š Update documentation to reflect integration requirements and constraints"
635        ])
636
637        return recommendations
638
639    def _assess_production_readiness(self, system_health: float, violations: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
640        """Assess overall production readiness based on compatibility analysis."""
641        critical_violations = [v for v in violations if v.get("severity") == "critical"]
642
643        if system_health >= 90 and len(critical_violations) == 0:
644            status = "production_ready"
645            confidence = "high"
646        elif system_health >= 80 and len(critical_violations) == 0:
647            status = "production_ready_with_monitoring"
648            confidence = "medium"
649        elif system_health >= 70:
650            status = "needs_improvement"
651            confidence = "low"
652        else:
653            status = "not_production_ready"
654            confidence = "very_low"
655
656        return {
657            "status": status,
658            "confidence": confidence,
659            "health_score": system_health,
660            "critical_blockers": len(critical_violations),
661            "recommendation": self._get_production_recommendation(status)
662        }
663
664    def _get_production_recommendation(self, status: str) -> str:
665        """Get production recommendation based on status."""
666        recommendations = {
667            "production_ready": "System is ready for production deployment with standard monitoring",
668            "production_ready_with_monitoring": "Deploy with enhanced monitoring and gradual rollout",
669            "needs_improvement": "Address compatibility issues before production deployment",
670            "not_production_ready": "Critical compatibility issues must be resolved before deployment"
671        }
672        return recommendations.get(status, "Unknown production status")
673
674def asdict(obj) -> Dict[str, Any]:
675    """Convert dataclass to dictionary (simplified implementation)."""
676    if hasattr(obj, '__dict__'):
677        result = {}
678        for key, value in obj.__dict__.items():
679            if isinstance(value, list):
680                result[key] = [asdict(item) if hasattr(item, '__dict__') else item for item in value]
681            elif hasattr(value, '__dict__'):
682                result[key] = asdict(value)
683            elif isinstance(value, Enum):
684                result[key] = value.value
685            else:
686                result[key] = value
687        return result
688    else:
689        return str(obj)
690
691def main():
692    """Main entry point for compatibility matrix analysis."""
693    matrix = CompatibilityMatrix()
694
695    print("ğŸ” Starting comprehensive compatibility analysis...")
696    results = matrix.analyze_full_system_compatibility()
697
698    print(f"\n{'='*80}")
699    print("SYSTEM COMPATIBILITY ANALYSIS RESULTS")
700    print(f"{'='*80}")
701    print(f"Overall Health Score: {results['system_health_score']:.1f}/100")
702    print(f"Analysis Duration: {results['analysis_duration']:.2f}s")
703    print(f"Production Ready: {results['production_readiness']['status']}")
704
705    print("\nğŸ¥ DOMAIN HEALTH:")
706    for domain, health in results['domain_health'].items():
707        status_icon = "âœ…" if health['overall_health'] == "compatible" else "âš ï¸" if health['overall_health'] == "warning" else "âŒ"
708        print(f"  {status_icon} {domain}: {health['overall_health']} ({health['component_count']} components)")
709
710    print("\nğŸ”— INTEGRATION POINTS:")
711    for point in results['integration_points']:
712        status_icon = "âœ…" if point['validation_status'] == "compatible" else "âš ï¸" if point['validation_status'] == "warning" else "âŒ"
713        print(f"  {status_icon} {point['source_domain']} â†’ {point['target_domain']}: {point['interface_type']}")
714
715    if results['rule_violations']:
716        print("\nğŸš¨ RULE VIOLATIONS:")
717        for violation in results['rule_violations']:
718            print(f"  - {violation['rule']}: {violation['description']}")
719
720    print("\nğŸ’¡ RECOMMENDATIONS:")
721    for rec in results['recommendations']:
722        print(f"  {rec}")
723
724    # Export results
725    output_path = PROJECT_ROOT / "artifacts" / "compatibility_analysis.json"
726    output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
727    with open(output_path, 'w') as f:
728        json.dump(results, f, indent=2)
729
730    print(f"\nğŸ“„ Full analysis exported to: {output_path}")
731
732if __name__ == "__main__":
733    main()

CompatibilityMatrixÂ¶

Comprehensive compatibility validation matrix for cross-domain integration.

This class provides sophisticated analysis of compatibility between all project domains, identifying potential integration issues and providing actionable recommendations for resolution.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class CompatibilityMatrix:
  2    """Comprehensive compatibility validation matrix for cross-domain integration.
  3
  4    This class provides sophisticated analysis of compatibility between all project
  5    domains, identifying potential integration issues and providing actionable
  6    recommendations for resolution.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, project_root: Path = PROJECT_ROOT):
 10        """Initialize compatibility matrix with comprehensive domain mapping.
 11
 12        Args:
 13            project_root: Path to the project root directory
 14        """
 15        self.project_root = project_root
 16        self.src_path = project_root / "src"
 17
 18        # Domain module mappings
 19        self.domain_modules = {
 20            DomainType.CONTROLLERS: [
 21                "src.controllers.factory",
 22                "src.controllers.smc",
 23                "src.controllers.mpc",
 24                "src.controllers.specialized"
 25            ],
 26            DomainType.OPTIMIZATION: [
 27                "src.optimizer.pso_optimizer"
 28            ],
 29            DomainType.TESTING: [
 30                "tests.test_controllers",
 31                "tests.test_optimization",
 32                "tests.test_integration"
 33            ],
 34            DomainType.ANALYSIS: [
 35                "src.utils.analysis",
 36                "src.utils.visualization",
 37                "src.benchmarks"
 38            ],
 39            DomainType.CONFIGURATION: [
 40                "src.config"
 41            ],
 42            DomainType.HIL: [
 43                "src.interfaces.hardware",
 44                "src.interfaces.hil"
 45            ],
 46            DomainType.INTERFACES: [
 47                "src.interfaces.data_exchange",
 48                "src.interfaces.monitoring"
 49            ],
 50            DomainType.UTILITIES: [
 51                "src.utils.validation",
 52                "src.utils.control",
 53                "src.utils.monitoring"
 54            ]
 55        }

 57        # Critical integration points
 58        self.integration_points = [
 59            IntegrationPoint(
 60                DomainType.CONTROLLERS, DomainType.OPTIMIZATION,

 72                ["test_fixtures", "stability_analysis", "performance_metrics"]

 74            IntegrationPoint(
 75                DomainType.ANALYSIS, DomainType.CONTROLLERS,
 76                "performance_monitoring", "unidirectional",
 77                ["metrics_collection", "visualization", "statistical_analysis"]

 80                DomainType.HIL, DomainType.CONTROLLERS,

 95                "constraint": "bounded_memory_usage",
 96                "threshold": "1GB"
 97            },

100                "constraint": "numerical_precision",

114
115    def analyze_full_system_compatibility(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
116        """Perform comprehensive compatibility analysis across all domains.
117
118        Returns:
119            Complete compatibility analysis results with recommendations
120        """
121        start_time = time.time()
122
123        # Analyze individual domain health
124        domain_health = self._analyze_domain_health()
125
126        # Validate integration points
127        integration_status = self._validate_integration_points()
128
129        # Check cross-domain compatibility rules
130        rule_violations = self._check_compatibility_rules()
131
132        # Identify potential conflicts
133        compatibility_issues = self._identify_compatibility_issues()
134
135        # Generate overall system health score
136        system_health = self._calculate_system_health_score(
137            domain_health, integration_status, rule_violations
138        )
139
140        # Generate actionable recommendations
141        recommendations = self._generate_compatibility_recommendations(
142            compatibility_issues, rule_violations
143        )
144
145        analysis_time = time.time() - start_time
146
147        return {
148            "timestamp": time.time(),
149            "analysis_duration": analysis_time,
150            "system_health_score": system_health,
151            "domain_health": {domain.value: asdict(health) for domain, health in domain_health.items()},
152            "integration_points": [asdict(point) for point in integration_status],
153            "rule_violations": rule_violations,
154            "compatibility_issues": [asdict(issue) for issue in compatibility_issues],
155            "recommendations": recommendations,
156            "production_readiness": self._assess_production_readiness(system_health, rule_violations)
157        }
158
159    def _analyze_domain_health(self) -> Dict[DomainType, DomainHealth]:
160        """Analyze health status of individual domains."""
161        domain_health = {}
162
163        for domain, modules in self.domain_modules.items():
164            try:
165                health = self._assess_single_domain_health(domain, modules)
166                domain_health[domain] = health
167            except Exception as e:
168                logger.warning(f"Failed to assess health for domain {domain.value}: {e}")
169                domain_health[domain] = DomainHealth(
170                    domain=domain,
171                    overall_health=CompatibilityLevel.UNKNOWN,
172                    component_count=0,
173                    test_coverage=0.0,
174                    integration_points=0
175                )
176
177        return domain_health
178
179    def _assess_single_domain_health(self, domain: DomainType, modules: List[str]) -> DomainHealth:
180        """Assess health of a single domain."""
181        component_count = 0
182        importable_modules = 0
183        critical_issues = []
184
185        for module_name in modules:
186            try:
187                # Try to import module to check availability
188                module = importlib.import_module(module_name)
189                importable_modules += 1
190
191                # Count components (classes and functions)
192                for name, obj in inspect.getmembers(module):
193                    if inspect.isclass(obj) or inspect.isfunction(obj):
194                        component_count += 1
195
196            except ImportError as e:
197                critical_issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
198                    domain_a=domain,
199                    domain_b=domain,
200                    component_a=module_name,
201                    component_b="import_system",
202                    issue_type="import_error",
203                    severity=CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE,
204                    description=f"Failed to import module {module_name}: {e}",
205                    recommendation="Fix import dependencies or module structure"
206                ))
207
208        # Calculate overall health
209        if len(critical_issues) > 0:
210            overall_health = CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE
211        elif importable_modules == len(modules):
212            overall_health = CompatibilityLevel.COMPATIBLE
213        else:
214            overall_health = CompatibilityLevel.WARNING
215
216        # Estimate test coverage (simplified)
217        test_coverage = self._estimate_domain_test_coverage(domain)
218
219        # Count integration points for this domain
220        integration_count = sum(1 for point in self.integration_points
221                              if point.source_domain == domain or point.target_domain == domain)
222
223        return DomainHealth(
224            domain=domain,
225            overall_health=overall_health,
226            component_count=component_count,
227            test_coverage=test_coverage,
228            integration_points=integration_count,
229            critical_issues=critical_issues
230        )
231
232    def _estimate_domain_test_coverage(self, domain: DomainType) -> float:
233        """Estimate test coverage for a domain (simplified implementation)."""
234        # This is a simplified estimation - in practice, would integrate with coverage tools
235        coverage_estimates = {
236            DomainType.CONTROLLERS: 85.0,
237            DomainType.OPTIMIZATION: 75.0,
238            DomainType.TESTING: 90.0,
239            DomainType.ANALYSIS: 70.0,
240            DomainType.CONFIGURATION: 80.0,
241            DomainType.HIL: 60.0,
242            DomainType.INTERFACES: 65.0,
243            DomainType.UTILITIES: 75.0
244        }
245        return coverage_estimates.get(domain, 50.0)
246
247    def _validate_integration_points(self) -> List[IntegrationPoint]:
248        """Validate all defined integration points for compatibility."""
249        validated_points = []
250
251        for point in self.integration_points:
252            try:
253                # Validate that source and target domains are healthy
254                source_health = self._check_domain_availability(point.source_domain)
255                target_health = self._check_domain_availability(point.target_domain)
256
257                if source_health and target_health:
258                    point.validation_status = CompatibilityLevel.COMPATIBLE
259                else:
260                    point.validation_status = CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE
261
262                validated_points.append(point)
263
264            except Exception as e:
265                logger.warning(f"Failed to validate integration point {point.interface_type}: {e}")
266                point.validation_status = CompatibilityLevel.UNKNOWN
267                validated_points.append(point)
268
269        return validated_points
270
271    def _check_domain_availability(self, domain: DomainType) -> bool:
272        """Check if a domain is available and functional."""
273        modules = self.domain_modules.get(domain, [])
274
275        for module_name in modules:
276            try:
277                importlib.import_module(module_name)
278            except ImportError:
279                return False
280
281        return True
282
283    def _check_compatibility_rules(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
284        """Check system-wide compatibility rules and constraints."""
285        violations = []
286
287        for rule_name, rule_config in self.compatibility_rules.items():
288            try:
289                violation = self._validate_compatibility_rule(rule_name, rule_config)
290                if violation:
291                    violations.append(violation)
292            except Exception as e:
293                logger.warning(f"Failed to check compatibility rule {rule_name}: {e}")
294
295        return violations
296
297    def _validate_compatibility_rule(self, rule_name: str, rule_config: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
298        """Validate a specific compatibility rule."""
299        domains = rule_config["domains"]
300        rule_config["constraint"]
301        threshold = rule_config["threshold"]
302
303        # Simplified rule validation - in practice, would implement specific checks
304        if rule_name == "memory_management":
305            # Check if memory-intensive domains have proper memory management
306            return self._check_memory_management_rule(domains, threshold)
307        elif rule_name == "numerical_stability":
308            # Check numerical precision across domains
309            return self._check_numerical_stability_rule(domains, threshold)
310        elif rule_name == "real_time_constraints":
311            # Check timing constraints for real-time domains
312            return self._check_real_time_constraints_rule(domains, threshold)
313        elif rule_name == "thread_safety":
314            # Check thread safety for concurrent domains
315            return self._check_thread_safety_rule(domains, threshold)
316
317        return None
318
319    def _check_memory_management_rule(self, domains: List[DomainType], threshold: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
320        """Check memory management compatibility rule."""
321        # Simplified check - in practice, would analyze actual memory usage
322        for domain in domains:
323            if domain == DomainType.OPTIMIZATION:
324                # PSO optimization can be memory intensive
325                return {
326                    "rule": "memory_management",
327                    "violated_domains": [domain.value],
328                    "severity": "warning",
329                    "description": f"Domain {domain.value} may exceed memory threshold {threshold}",
330                    "recommendation": "Implement bounded memory usage in PSO algorithms"
331                }
332        return None
333
334    def _check_numerical_stability_rule(self, domains: List[DomainType], threshold: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
335        """Check numerical stability compatibility rule."""
336        # Check for potential numerical stability issues
337        return None  # Assume stable for now
338
339    def _check_real_time_constraints_rule(self, domains: List[DomainType], threshold: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
340        """Check real-time constraints compatibility rule."""
341        # Check if real-time domains meet timing requirements
342        for domain in domains:
343            if domain == DomainType.HIL:
344                # HIL systems have strict timing requirements
345                return {
346                    "rule": "real_time_constraints",
347                    "violated_domains": [domain.value],
348                    "severity": "critical",
349                    "description": f"Domain {domain.value} must meet {threshold} timing deadline",
350                    "recommendation": "Validate real-time performance in HIL integration tests"
351                }
352        return None
353
354    def _check_thread_safety_rule(self, domains: List[DomainType], threshold: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
355        """Check thread safety compatibility rule."""
356        # Check thread safety for concurrent access
357        for domain in domains:
358            if domain in [DomainType.HIL, DomainType.INTERFACES]:
359                # These domains may have thread safety issues
360                return {
361                    "rule": "thread_safety",
362                    "violated_domains": [domain.value],
363                    "severity": "warning",
364                    "description": f"Domain {domain.value} requires thread safety validation",
365                    "recommendation": "Implement thread safety tests for concurrent operations"
366                }
367        return None
368
369    def _identify_compatibility_issues(self) -> List[CompatibilityIssue]:
370        """Identify potential compatibility issues between domains."""
371        issues = []
372
373        # Check for known compatibility issues
374        issues.extend(self._check_controller_optimization_compatibility())
375        issues.extend(self._check_hil_interface_compatibility())
376        issues.extend(self._check_testing_configuration_compatibility())
377
378        return issues
379
380    def _check_controller_optimization_compatibility(self) -> List[CompatibilityIssue]:
381        """Check compatibility between controllers and optimization domains."""
382        issues = []
383
384        # Check parameter bounds compatibility
385        try:
386            # Check if both domains are available
387            import importlib.util
388            has_controllers = importlib.util.find_spec('src.controllers.factory') is not None
389            has_optimizer = importlib.util.find_spec('src.optimizer.pso_optimizer') is not None
390
391            # Check if gain bounds are compatible
392            if not (has_controllers and has_optimizer):
393                return CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE
394            # This is a simplified check - would implement detailed validation
395            issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
396                domain_a=DomainType.CONTROLLERS,
397                domain_b=DomainType.OPTIMIZATION,
398                component_a="SMCFactory",
399                component_b="PSOTuner",
400                issue_type="parameter_bounds",
401                severity=CompatibilityLevel.WARNING,
402                description="PSO parameter bounds may not be optimally configured for all controllers",
403                recommendation="Validate PSO bounds against controller stability requirements",
404                affected_functionality=["automated_tuning", "gain_optimization"]
405            ))
406
407        except ImportError as e:
408            issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
409                domain_a=DomainType.CONTROLLERS,
410                domain_b=DomainType.OPTIMIZATION,
411                component_a="controller_factory",
412                component_b="pso_optimizer",
413                issue_type="import_dependency",
414                severity=CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE,
415                description=f"Failed to import required modules: {e}",
416                recommendation="Fix import dependencies between controllers and optimization"
417            ))
418
419        return issues
420
421    def _check_hil_interface_compatibility(self) -> List[CompatibilityIssue]:
422        """Check compatibility between HIL and interface domains."""
423        issues = []
424
425        # Check for HIL interface compatibility
426        try:
427            # Try to access HIL interfaces
428            hil_path = self.src_path / "interfaces" / "hil"
429            if not hil_path.exists():
430                issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
431                    domain_a=DomainType.HIL,
432                    domain_b=DomainType.INTERFACES,
433                    component_a="hil_system",
434                    component_b="interface_layer",
435                    issue_type="missing_interface",
436                    severity=CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE,
437                    description="HIL interface layer is missing or incomplete",
438                    recommendation="Implement complete HIL interface abstraction layer"
439                ))
440
441        except Exception as e:
442            logger.warning(f"Failed to check HIL interface compatibility: {e}")
443
444        return issues
445
446    def _check_testing_configuration_compatibility(self) -> List[CompatibilityIssue]:
447        """Check compatibility between testing and configuration domains."""
448        issues = []
449
450        # Check configuration validation in tests
451        try:
452            # Check if test configuration is compatible with main configuration
453            config_path = self.project_root / "config.yaml"
454            if config_path.exists():
455                # Configuration exists - check test compatibility
456                pass  # Simplified - would implement detailed validation
457            else:
458                issues.append(CompatibilityIssue(
459                    domain_a=DomainType.TESTING,
460                    domain_b=DomainType.CONFIGURATION,
461                    component_a="test_config",
462                    component_b="main_config",
463                    issue_type="missing_configuration",
464                    severity=CompatibilityLevel.WARNING,
465                    description="Main configuration file missing for test validation",
466                    recommendation="Ensure config.yaml exists and is properly structured"
467                ))
468
469        except Exception as e:
470            logger.warning(f"Failed to check testing configuration compatibility: {e}")
471
472        return issues
473
474    def _calculate_system_health_score(self, domain_health: Dict[DomainType, DomainHealth],
475                                     integration_status: List[IntegrationPoint],
476                                     rule_violations: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> float:
477        """Calculate overall system health score (0-100)."""
478        # Domain health contribution (60% of total score)
479        domain_scores = []
480        for health in domain_health.values():
481            if health.overall_health == CompatibilityLevel.COMPATIBLE:
482                domain_scores.append(100.0)
483            elif health.overall_health == CompatibilityLevel.WARNING:
484                domain_scores.append(70.0)
485            elif health.overall_health == CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE:
486                domain_scores.append(20.0)
487            else:
488                domain_scores.append(50.0)
489
490        domain_score = sum(domain_scores) / len(domain_scores) if domain_scores else 0
491
492        # Integration points contribution (30% of total score)
493        integration_scores = []
494        for point in integration_status:
495            if point.validation_status == CompatibilityLevel.COMPATIBLE:
496                integration_scores.append(100.0)
497            elif point.validation_status == CompatibilityLevel.WARNING:
498                integration_scores.append(70.0)
499            elif point.validation_status == CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE:
500                integration_scores.append(20.0)
501            else:
502                integration_scores.append(50.0)
503
504        integration_score = sum(integration_scores) / len(integration_scores) if integration_scores else 100
505
506        # Rule violations penalty (10% of total score)
507        violation_penalty = len([v for v in rule_violations if v.get("severity") == "critical"]) * 20
508        violation_penalty += len([v for v in rule_violations if v.get("severity") == "warning"]) * 10
509        violation_score = max(0, 100 - violation_penalty)
510
511        # Calculate weighted total
512        total_score = (domain_score * 0.6) + (integration_score * 0.3) + (violation_score * 0.1)
513
514        return round(total_score, 1)
515
516    def _generate_compatibility_recommendations(self, issues: List[CompatibilityIssue],
517                                              violations: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> List[str]:
518        """Generate actionable recommendations for resolving compatibility issues."""
519        recommendations = []
520
521        # Process compatibility issues
522        critical_issues = [issue for issue in issues if issue.severity == CompatibilityLevel.INCOMPATIBLE]
523        warning_issues = [issue for issue in issues if issue.severity == CompatibilityLevel.WARNING]
524
525        if critical_issues:
526            recommendations.append(f"ğŸš¨ CRITICAL: Address {len(critical_issues)} incompatible components before production")
527            for issue in critical_issues[:3]:  # Top 3 critical issues
528                recommendations.append(f"   - {issue.recommendation}")
529
530        if warning_issues:
531            recommendations.append(f"âš ï¸ WARNING: Review {len(warning_issues)} compatibility warnings")
532            for issue in warning_issues[:2]:  # Top 2 warnings
533                recommendations.append(f"   - {issue.recommendation}")
534
535        # Process rule violations
536        critical_violations = [v for v in violations if v.get("severity") == "critical"]
537        warning_violations = [v for v in violations if v.get("severity") == "warning"]
538
539        if critical_violations:
540            recommendations.append(f"ğŸ”¥ URGENT: Resolve {len(critical_violations)} critical rule violations")
541            for violation in critical_violations:
542                recommendations.append(f"   - {violation.get('recommendation', 'Address violation')}")
543
544        if warning_violations:
545            recommendations.append(f"ğŸ“‹ REVIEW: Address {len(warning_violations)} rule warnings")
546
547        # General recommendations
548        recommendations.extend([
549            "ğŸ§ª Run comprehensive integration tests to validate cross-domain functionality",
550            "ğŸ“Š Monitor system health scores and address degradation promptly",
551            "ğŸ”„ Implement continuous compatibility monitoring in CI/CD pipeline",
552            "ğŸ“š Update documentation to reflect integration requirements and constraints"
553        ])
554
555        return recommendations
556
557    def _assess_production_readiness(self, system_health: float, violations: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
558        """Assess overall production readiness based on compatibility analysis."""
559        critical_violations = [v for v in violations if v.get("severity") == "critical"]
560
561        if system_health >= 90 and len(critical_violations) == 0:
562            status = "production_ready"
563            confidence = "high"
564        elif system_health >= 80 and len(critical_violations) == 0:
565            status = "production_ready_with_monitoring"
566            confidence = "medium"
567        elif system_health >= 70:
568            status = "needs_improvement"
569            confidence = "low"
570        else:
571            status = "not_production_ready"
572            confidence = "very_low"
573
574        return {
575            "status": status,
576            "confidence": confidence,
577            "health_score": system_health,
578            "critical_blockers": len(critical_violations),
579            "recommendation": self._get_production_recommendation(status)
580        }
581
582    def _get_production_recommendation(self, status: str) -> str:
583        """Get production recommendation based on status."""
584        recommendations = {
585            "production_ready": "System is ready for production deployment with standard monitoring",
586            "production_ready_with_monitoring": "Deploy with enhanced monitoring and gradual rollout",
587            "needs_improvement": "Address compatibility issues before production deployment",
588            "not_production_ready": "Critical compatibility issues must be resolved before deployment"
589        }
590        return recommendations.get(status, "Unknown production status")

asdict(obj)Â¶

Convert dataclass to dictionary (simplified implementation).

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def asdict(obj) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 2    """Convert dataclass to dictionary (simplified implementation)."""
 3    if hasattr(obj, '__dict__'):
 4        result = {}
 5        for key, value in obj.__dict__.items():
 6            if isinstance(value, list):
 7                result[key] = [asdict(item) if hasattr(item, '__dict__') else item for item in value]
 8            elif hasattr(value, '__dict__'):
 9                result[key] = asdict(value)
10            elif isinstance(value, Enum):
11                result[key] = value.value
12            else:
13                result[key] = value
14        return result
15    else:
16        return str(obj)

main()Â¶

Main entry point for compatibility matrix analysis.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def main():
 2    """Main entry point for compatibility matrix analysis."""
 3    matrix = CompatibilityMatrix()
 4
 5    print("ğŸ” Starting comprehensive compatibility analysis...")
 6    results = matrix.analyze_full_system_compatibility()
 7
 8    print(f"\n{'='*80}")
 9    print("SYSTEM COMPATIBILITY ANALYSIS RESULTS")
10    print(f"{'='*80}")
11    print(f"Overall Health Score: {results['system_health_score']:.1f}/100")
12    print(f"Analysis Duration: {results['analysis_duration']:.2f}s")
13    print(f"Production Ready: {results['production_readiness']['status']}")
14
15    print("\nğŸ¥ DOMAIN HEALTH:")
16    for domain, health in results['domain_health'].items():
17        status_icon = "âœ…" if health['overall_health'] == "compatible" else "âš ï¸" if health['overall_health'] == "warning" else "âŒ"
18        print(f"  {status_icon} {domain}: {health['overall_health']} ({health['component_count']} components)")
19
20    print("\nğŸ”— INTEGRATION POINTS:")
21    for point in results['integration_points']:
22        status_icon = "âœ…" if point['validation_status'] == "compatible" else "âš ï¸" if point['validation_status'] == "warning" else "âŒ"
23        print(f"  {status_icon} {point['source_domain']} â†’ {point['target_domain']}: {point['interface_type']}")
24
25    if results['rule_violations']:
26        print("\nğŸš¨ RULE VIOLATIONS:")
27        for violation in results['rule_violations']:
28            print(f"  - {violation['rule']}: {violation['description']}")
29
30    print("\nğŸ’¡ RECOMMENDATIONS:")
31    for rec in results['recommendations']:
32        print(f"  {rec}")
33
34    # Export results
35    output_path = PROJECT_ROOT / "artifacts" / "compatibility_analysis.json"
36    output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
37    with open(output_path, 'w') as f:
38        json.dump(results, f, indent=2)
39
40    print(f"\nğŸ“„ Full analysis exported to: {output_path}")
